summary: Frank L Eccles is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) based on payroll certifications from October 1977, November 1977, and May 1978. The documents list Eccles' name, position, and salary information as part of the committee's staff. While the specific role of Frank L Eccles within the HSCA is not detailed in these documents, the payroll certifications confirm their employment during the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Frank L Eccles' significance lies in their employment with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), indicating their involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of their contribution are not detailed in the provided documents.
